She is requesting a loan in order to buy sheep, chickens, and corn in large quantities because she knows that the prices have increased. She has already been in business for 30 years. When she was a young girl, her parents were in the same line of work. Her parents would take their animals out to pasture, but times have changed since there is no place for her animals to graze. Therefore, she must buy food for her animals such as grasses, ground corn, and other types of feed.

Doña Olga’s greatest challenge is when her animals get sick because she does not have the resources to cover veterinary expenses and medicines. Each month she has to buy a powdered remedy for her chickens and also have her sheep checked for parasites. Her goal is to have savings set aside for emergencies. She and her husband are older, so they are not able to continue working as easily as before.

Doña Olga is very grateful because the loans have enabled her to buy several animals. She always tries to save, but whenever she is able to treat herself, she buys things that she needs such as new shoes, shawls, and other items. Doña Olga and the other members of her group are very pleased and appreciative of FRAC and Kiva because they will be able to invest in their businesses. Trinidad and Carmen will buy sheep, while Beatriz will buy chickens.

loans.use: to buy sheep, chickens, and corn.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is 41 years old and is married with six children between the ages of 18 and 22. She stopped her education in third grade. Dorris lives in Buchanan. She has been running a cook shop (restaurant) which she started with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys the money that she earns from her business every day.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more food stocks (rice, oil, pepper, fish and meat) and charcoal for her business. Dorris hopes to have her own house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more food stocks (rice, oil, pepper, fish and meat) and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been teaching for two years, and is very proud of being a teacher as it has always been her passion. Her personal goals are educating children and building a permanent house.

Additionally, Mary has a business goal, which is to buy some land to grow crops.  She wants to borrow this money to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a forty-nine-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She is a health worker, and has been in service for ten years. Her personal goal is educating children, and she also has an ambition of starting a business in the next two years. 

Ruth would like to borrow this money in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: C 7598 Korandebe Group

texts.en:
Juvenal is 45 years old, and is married with 2 children aged between 12 and 16 years old. He owns an agriculture business selling rice, and his business is open from 6 am to 2 pm every week day. Juvenal is a leader of the group which called " C 7598 KORANDEBE" in local language. He is the one with his hand raised in the photo.  He currently employs 3 people to help him, and he has 10 years of experience in this work. 

Juvenal has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To expand his agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell.

loans.name: Mecatepec Group

texts.es:
Noemí es una mujer soltera que cuenta con 48 años está feliz   porque vive y trabaja solo para ella, es una mujer capaz de hacerse valer por sí misma. 
Noemí  es comerciante y tiene un tiendita de abarrotes, lo cual tiene 8 años con su negocio y quiere seguir adelante con su negocio, pero ella necesita más mercancía porque sus clientes le piden los productos como son: Clarasol, Azúcar, Arroz, Leche entre otros productos, y en esa mercancía piensa invertir su préstamo, porque quiere seguir sacando buenas ganancias y con ellas hacer más grande su negocio, es decir poner un local más grande por ejemplo.
Noemí es una de las integrantes del Grupo Mecatepec, dicho grupo está conformado por 9 mujeres y 2 hombres lo cual se hacen mención: Isaac que compra Maíz para la elaboración de tortillas, Leticia vende helados, Gabriela vende ropa, Miney compra Medicamentos para el cuidado de los animales que vende como Vacas, borregos etc., María vende tacos, Ernestina vende maíz, Eliuth vende dulces, Araceli vende tamales, Aureliana vende pescado, Noemí vende en una tienda de abarrotes, Marina vende cosméticos.
texts.en:
Noemí is a single woman who says that she is 48 years of age. She is happy because she lives and works only for herself. She is a capable woman who is full of self-worth.

Noemí is a merchant who manages a small grocery store. She has been in business for eight years and wants to continue moving forward, but she needs more merchandise that her customers want. These items include disinfectants, sugar, rice, milk, and other products. She plans to invest her loan in these items because she wants to continue generating good earnings and use the profits to expand her business. In other words, she wants to have a larger store.

Noemí is a member of the group called “Mecatepec”, which consists of nine women and two men. They are listed below: • Isaac will buy corn for making tortillas. • Leticia sells ice cream. • Gabriela sells clothing. • Miney will buy medicines for the animals she sells (cows, sheep, etc.). • María sells tacos. • Ernestina sells corn. • Eliuth sells candy. • Araceli sells tamales. • Aureliana sells fish. • Noemí sells groceries from her store. • Marina sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy disinfectants, sugar, rice, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives together with her husband at Mpohor near Takoradi. She sells video CDs, which she has done for 8 years now. She uses her income to support her husband and pay their utility bills. Florence will use her loan to purchase more video CDs to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more video CDs to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a petty (small-scale) trader. She sells cosmetics at Mpohor near Takoradi. She has been selling cosmetics for 6 years. She is married, and her husband is a small-scale miner. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Florence will use her loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more  cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For eleven years he has been a teacher and is so passionate about his job. His personal goal is building a permanent house and educating his children. John wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys operates a grocery shop at Mpoho near Takoradi. This she has done for 4  years. The items in her grocery shop are tin fish, tin tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, and powdered milk. She is married, with 4  children. Gladys uses her income to help her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Gladys plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is a food vendor. She cooks banku (corn/cassava dough), which she serves with okro (okra) and fish stew. Yaa has done this for three years. 

She lives with her husband in Mpoho near Takoradi. Her husband is a farmer and they have three children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees. 

Yaa's loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish to sell with her prepared banku. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to create a place where her customers can eat.

loans.use: to purchase maize and fish to sell with her prepared banku

loans.name: Janjay T.

texts.en:
Janjay lives in Buchanan and is 34 years old. She did not go to school and is married with three children between the ages of two and ten. They are in school and live at home.

For ten years, Janjay has been selling rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra and palm oil in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and Janjay gained her experience from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra and palm oil for her business. 

She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet operates a grocery store. She has been doing this for five years now. The items in her grocery shop include a variety of drinks, biscuits, toffees and powdered milk. 

She is married to a farmer and has three dependants. Janet uses her income to help her husband pay for their children’s school fees. 

She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Janet plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a hard working, married man with five children living in Hioma, Uganda. 

For four years, he has been selling fish and with the income earned, he has been able to adequately support his family. He started out by selling textiles, then later ventured into the fish business and he says he is happy with the decision.

He faces the challenges of price fluctuations and seasonal weather variations that affect his earnings. His family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house for his family. His business goal is to expand into new markets and buy land to venture into crop growing. 

Godfrey needs the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena cooks kenkey to sell. She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce in Mpoho near Takoradi.  

She is married and has five children. Abena has been doing this for three years. She uses her income to support her husband in providing food and paying their accomodation bills. 

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses to prepare her kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to establish a stall for the sale of her kenkey and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses to prepare her kenkey for sale

loans.name: Kusiima

texts.en:
Kusiima is 42 years old and married with eight children. She lives in Hioma, Uganda. 

Kusiima owns a restaurant, which she has been operating for a long time now. She faces the challenges of price fluctuations and the high cost of food.

Her family goal is to educate her children and build a permanent house. She wishes to expand her business and also diversify and venture into the transport sector, so as to increase her income sources. Kusiima intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a food vendor. She sells fried plantain and bean stew in Mpoho near Tarkoradi. She has done this for 11 years. 

Rebecca uses her income to pay her utility and accomodation bills. She will use her loan to purchase plantain and beans to use in the preparation of her food to sell. 

With the new profit, Rebecca wants to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase plantain and beans to use in the preparation of her food to sell

loans.name: Otgonhorloo

texts.en: Otgonhorloo is a 29-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed. Her children study at the secondary schools and kindergarten. She started running a garment retail business in 2010. She rents a shop counter at local trade center and trades the garments for women and men. As she has paid the 800,000 MNT deposit for the building, she has a clow budget to purchase the supplies. Otgonhorloo is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to continue the business activities successfully by having some support on the business." The total amount she is requesting is 1,400,000 MNT to buy more garments for spring.

loans.use: to buy more garments for spring.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 30-year-old lady, is married to Abdala and they have two children, ages 10 and 6 years.

Miriam operates a computer internet cafe, and has been doing this business for the last year and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is now taking a first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a printer. Her profits will be used to educate her children.Her dream is to open a computer training school.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is married with three children between 8 and 10 years old. All of them are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 15 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009.) Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and support labor costs.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon is a 36-year-old, married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in teaching for five years. His personal goals are educating children, building a permanent home and self education. His business goal is buying land to grow crops. Amon wants money to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Felicity

texts.en:
Felicity is a petty trader. She trades in bags, jeans and shoes and has done so for 15 years. 

Felicity is a single parent and has two children. They live in Mpoho near Takoradi. She uses her income to feed and cloth her children. 

Felicity will use her loan to purchase more bags, jeans and shoes to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Felicity wishes to acquire a shop to sell her goods from.

loans.use: to purchase more bags, jeans and shoes to sell

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is married with two children between 8 and 10 years old. All of them are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a farmer. She has been a rice farmer for eight years. She would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009.) Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and seeds during rice production.

loans.name: Tatevik

texts.en:
Tatevik is 23 years old. She is a student of Yerevan State University’s Historical department. She is in her second year of her MA coursework. At the same time, Tatevik works as an interviewer at Institute of Political and Sociological Consulting. Tatevik hopes to find a job as a historian or history teacher after graduation, as she likes history very much.

Tatevik needs a 130.000 AMD loan to pay her tuition fee at university.

Tatevik lives in Katnaghbyur village, Aragatsotni region, with her parents. Tatevik’s father is engaged in furniture production; her mother is a teacher at school.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee at university.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren is a 44-year-old woman, who lives with her two daughters in Uvurhangai province, Central Mongolia. Since her husband left, all the responsibility of taking care of her daughters rests with her. The daughters study at the secondary school. 

She has been running a public announcement business at the local trade center. She started her business in 2001. The business is stable and she has also started selling some chancellery and computer services. Dolgorsuren is an educated, and diligent woman who says that "I would like to expand my business activities by purchasing the necessary equipment for the business". 

The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy equipment for her computer service business.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her computer service business

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en:
Uyanga is a 40-year-old woman, who lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her children go to the secondary school and kindergarten. 

She runs an office stationery store business with her husband. The store is located near the big trade center. She has gained a number of regular customers and the business is stable. Uyanga is a hardworking woman who says that "I would like to expand my business activity by purchasing the supplies wholesale. I am planning to buy an apartment with the income from the business". 

The total amount she is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy more stationery supplies to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more stationery supplies

loans.name: Abizeranye /rgt Group

texts.fr:
Fiacre fait partie du groupe Abizeranye / Rgt. Le nom du groupe signifie «responsable les uns à aux autres». Il a 45 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 7 ans  à 9 ans, dont 5  scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Fiacre est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demander d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités agricoles. Dans les prochaines années, Fiacre voudrait devenir le meilleur agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fiacre is part of the Abizeranye / Rgt group, the name of which means “everyone is responsible for one another”. He is 45 years of age and is a married father of five children aged between seven and nine, all of whom go to school. He has six years of elementary school education.
Fiacre is a rice farmer, and this is his second loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use his loan to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay his labor expenses.
To expand his business Fiacre plans to request further loans to increase his agricultural activity. Over the coming years, he would like to become the best rice farmer in his region. He will use the profits he makes to pay for his children’s education and medical expenses.

loans.use: To purchase chemical fertilizers and pay his labor expenses.

loans.name: Bignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BIGNON est formé de trois personnes ayant la même affinité parentale. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Assiba Colette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Assiba Colette est âgée de 64 ans et est une veuve. Assiba Colette a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Assiba Colette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Assiba Colette vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les charges de la maison. Pour y parvenir, Assiba Colette vend du vin de palme, du charbon de bois et des divers. Assiba Colette vend aussi de l’eau de pompe de façon secondaire à son domicile. Assiba Colette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Assiba Colette désire obtenir un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BIGNON. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The BIGNON group is formed by three people who are all related to each other. The group’s representative is Assiba Colette, who is pictured with her arm raised in the photo. This is the second time that this group has requested financial support from Alidé to increase its activity. Assiba Colette is a 64 year-old widow and has five children, all of whom are in school. She herself did not attend school and lives alone with her children, so is responsible for all the household costs. To cover these expenses she sells palm wine, charcoal and miscellaneous products. Assiba Colette also sells pumped water from her home as a secondary activity. She obtains her supplies from a market in Benin. To increase her product stock and meet the needs of her customers, Assiba Colette hopes to obtain a second loan from Alidé along with the rest of the BIGNON group members. Their previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal and miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Dusangirimirimo Group

texts.fr:
Philémon fait partie du groupe Dusangirimirimo. Le nom du groupe signifie «Partageons les travails». Il a 46 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 3 ans  à 20 ans, dont 5  scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Philémon est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de demander d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités agricoles. Dans les prochaines années, Philémon voudrait devenir le meilleur agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Philémon is part of the Dusangirimirimo group, the name of which means “we share the work”. He is 46 years of age and is a married father of six children aged between three and 20, five of whom go to school. He has six years of elementary school education. 
Philémon is a rice farmer, and this is his second loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use his loan to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay his labor expenses.
To expand his business Philémon plans to request further loans to increase his agricultural activity. Over the coming years, he would like to become the best rice farmer in his region. He will use the profits he makes to pay for his children’s education and medical expenses.

loans.use: To purchase chemical fertilizers and pay his labor costs.

loans.name: La Esperanza Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
El grupo  se llama la esperanza del futuro  y se integra de tres señoras quien cada una se dedica a su respectiva actividad y viven en una comunidad llamada Benito Juárez  en la que celebran la fiesta de san José el 19 de marzo.

    Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Berorisa, ella es casada con  el señor Cesario y  con quien procreo seis  hijos quienes tres están a su responsabilidad y tres ya casados.
 
    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compara de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes en donde lleva trabajando cinco, en la que comenta  que le va bien ya que con ello  ha mejorado mucho  sus ingresos y  su  actividad.
 
   Ella inicio con esta actividad ya que aprendió desde joven pero  reinicio hace cinco años para seguir apoyando  a su esposo con los ingresos de su casa  y así seguir apoyando a sus hijos que están estudiando. 

    Lo que desea es que con esta actividad y el préstamo  que le han estado otorgando  ella siga adelante hasta que dios le peste vida.

       La personas que integran en el grupo son: Martha quine invertirá en la compra de leche para elaborar quesos y la señora María Deysi   invertirá en la compra  de productos por catalogo.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called "Esperanza del Futuro" and comprised of three women who each has her respective business and lives in a community called Benito Juárez where they celebrate the Saint Joseph festivities on March 19th.

The person interviewed was Beroisa who is married to Cesario.  They have six children, three of whom are still under their care while three are married.

She has requested a loan to buy ingredients to make bread.  Beroisa has been in business for five years and says it is going well since she has been able to increase her activity and income.

She learned the trade when she was young, but started working at it again five years ago to help her husband cover household expenses and give her children an education.

Her goal is, through her business and with the loan she is receiving, to continue getting ahead until the end of her days.

The members of the group are: Martha, who will buy milk to make cheese, and María Deysi, who will buy products through catalogue.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
La Cañada es el nonbre de un grupo integrado por 20 personas amables, trabajadoras y alegres, cada uno de os integrantes de este grupo tiene una actividad economica la cual desarrollan con la intencion da ganar un poco de dinero extra y asi dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias, este grupo esta ubicado en una zona cañera y su gente se dedica al trabajo de campo(siembra y corte de caña de azucar).
Los integrantes de este grupo son:

Adela Venta de dulces 
Rosalia Venta de abarrotes 
Aurora venta de refrescos 
georgina venta de calzado 
Ignacia venta de abarrotes 
Maria Esther venta de refrescos
Alicia venta de dulces
Maria Teresa venta de dulces 
Micaela Frutas y legumbres
Jose Roberto servicio de Alzadora
Minerva Venta de ropa 
Maria antonia venta de ropa 
Caritina Venta de Cosmeticos
Lorena venta de antojitos 
Silvio Club de Nutricion
Margarita Club de nutricion
Maria Guadalupe Molino 
Roberta Venta de bisuteria
Maria elena Venta de antojitos
Ofelio frutas y legumbres


Rosalía es una mujer de 43 años de edad, que solo estudio el 2 º grado de la escuela primaria. Ella ahora está casada con Eduardo, que trabaja como jornalero. Tienen dos hijos, Cristanta, 19 años  y Eduarda 13 años que estudia la secundaria.

Rosalía platica que desde hace dos años inicio a trabajar en su propio negocio vendiendo refrescos en su hogar  ya que queria apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y darle mas estudios a su hija, Ella dice que al pasar del tiempo su negocio continuo cresiendo y poco a poco ha invertido mas en su negocio y paso de ser una refresqueria a una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su hogar el cual esta a orilla de carretera lo cual ayuda a rasalia a tener mas ventas ya que muchos de los viajeros se detienen a tomarse un refresco, Lo que mas le gusta a Rosalia de su negocio es que puede atenderlo sin descuidar a su familia.

Ella invertira este credito en la compra de  refrescoss, galletas,papel de baño, jabon, cloro, jugos, arroz, frijol, dulces, huevos, azucar, sal y sopa

Rosalia desea que con este inversion su  negocio progrese y de mas ganancias ya que  a futuro desea poder pagar los estudios de universidad de su hija.

Este grupo agradece el apoyo que la fundacion les ha bridado atravez de este prestamo
texts.en:
"La Cañada" is the name of the communal bank comprised of 20 members who are kind, hard-working and cheerful.  Each member of the group has his/her own business, trying to make extra income to improve their family's lifestyles.  This group is located in the sugarcane area and most people work in the fields (planting or cutting sugarcane).  

The members of this group are:

Adela, who sells sweets
Rosalia, who sells groceries
Aurora, who sells soft drinks
Georgina, who sells shoes
Ignacia, who sells groceries
Maria Esther, who sells softdrinks
Alicia, who sells sweets
Maria Teresa, who sells sweets
Micaela, who sells fruits and vegetables
Jose Roberto, collection services
Minerva, who sells clothing
Maria Antonia, who sells clothing
Caritina, who sells cosmetics
Lorena, who sells snack foods
Silvio, who has a nutrition club
Margarita, who has a nutrition club
Maria Guadalupe, grinding services
Roberta, who sells costume jewelry
Maria Elena, who sells snack foods
Ofelio, who sells fruits and vegetables

Rosalía, 43, only has a second grade education.  She is married to Eduardo who is a wage earner.  They have two children, Crisanta, 19, and Eduarda, 13, who are in high school.

Rosalía says she started her own soft drink business two years ago, out of her home, since she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and to give her daughter an education.  She claims that business has grown little by little, and what was once a soft drink business has now become a small grocery store.  Her house is located on a road that has many travelers who stop for refreshments; so this increases her sales volume.  What Rosalía enjoys most about her business is that she can work without neglecting her family.

She will use the loan to buy soft drinks, cookies, toilet tissue, soap, bleach, juices, rice, beans, sweets, eggs, sugar, salt and soups.  She hopes this investment will help her business grow and increase her profits so she can pay for her daughter's university studies.

This group is grateful to the foundation for the support through the loan.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, cookies, juices, rice, beans, eggs, sugar, salt and soups.

location.town: Cañada san Antonio,  Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oa

loans.name: Vladimir Ramon

texts.es: Don Vladimir Ramon, caballero esforzado y luchador, tiene 52 años de edad, soltero. El tiene una venta de comida tipica nicaraguense, negocio que le apasiona. Su principal inquietud en esta ocasión esta el seguirle realizando mejoras a su puesto de comida ya que para el es muy importante la buena presentacion de su negocio que le permitira alcanzar mayor captacion de sus clientes y mejorar sus ganancias. Siendo este su quinto ciclo de credito comprara 20 bolsas de cemento, arena, piso, separadores, colorante de piso y de esta forma dar inicio a la reparacion de sus cocina y al fogon donde el mismo realiza sus ventas de fritanga. Agradece la oportunidad de pertenecer a la familia de créditos de la micro-financiera que realizara gran cambio en su vida plasmándose en la oportunidad de mercado que obtendrá. Su plan a futuro es seguir cosechando mas éxito con su negocio de fritanga.
texts.en:
Vladimir Ramon, 52 and single, is a hard-working, determined man.  He has a business selling typical Nicaraguan dishes, which he loves.  His main concern on this occasion is to continue renovating his food stall, since a good image is important for his business and will attract more customers and improve profits.  

This is his fifth loan, which he will use to buy 20 bags of cement, sand, flooring, dividers, and floor color so he can start renovating his kitchen and stove area, where he makes the meals he sells.  He is grateful for the opportunity to belong to the micro-finance loan family, which has made such a significant change in his life, giving him the market opportunity he will have.  His goal for the future is to continue successfully in his food business.

loans.use: To repair his kitchen and stove.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married with three children who range in age from three to 12. All the children have managed to attend school. His wife is a farmer and he has been a rice farmer for 10 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area which he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and support labor costs in rice production.

loans.name: La Nopalera Group

texts.es:
El grpo la nopalera esta integrado por tres mujeres y dos hombres ellos viven ene una comunidad llamada San Antonio Enchisi es una comunidda muy tranquila donde tambien se carracteriza por el cultivo de nopales, es por eso que el grupo se llama la nopalera.
Don Elias quien es el representante del grupo nos cuenta que tiene 43 años de edad esta casado con la señora Teresa desde hace 20 años juntos han procreado cinco niños que se encuentran estudiando es por eso que a Don Elias es muy trabajador ya que se preocupa mucho por sus niños, El se dedica a al cultivo del nopal en dicha actividda lleva ya 12 años aunque la idea del negocio fue su esposa Teresa, esta vez ha solicitado el credito para comprar abono organico llalmado estiercol, nos comenta que le gusta mucho e cultivo de los nopales a unque tambien hace incapie que debemos tener mucho cuidado a la hora de sembrar paraq ue no se rompa la raqueta tambien tener mucho cuidado para que no se les pegue la plaga la cual es la araña roja, esta ocaciona que el nopal se pinte de color rojo y esto acaciona que el nopal deje de producir. auque nos suene un pocoa alaramante esta situacion para don Elias no es asi ya que comenta que sabe muy bien que hacer cuando pasa esto, la dificultad mas grande para don Elias es la falta de dinero ya que no tiene dinero para invertir mas en su cultivo de nopal como el quisiera ya que le gustaria amplair su terreno de nopales necesita mas estrutura para techar su nopal.
La meta de don Elias es llegar a ser un mejor productor y mejorra su calidad en cuanto al nopal, aunque tambien demostro su agradecimiento ya que comenta que gracias al credito el pudo invertir mas y ahora ya tiene un poco mas de producto ahora ya no solo vende el nopal normal si no que tambien tiene pedidos de licuados y tortilla. Con las ganacias que obtiene las invierte en la educaion de sus hijos, ropa, alimentacion, calzado para toda la familia. En generel todo el grupo esta muy agradecido por el prestamo otorgado ya que podos podran invertir en lo que les haga falta, Don Ponciano comprara abono para sus nopales, Delgadina comprar verdura para su venta Teresa y Francisca compraran abono para nopales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "La Nopalera" is comprised of three women and two men who live in a community called San Antonio Enchisi.  It is a very quiet location known for its nopal (prickly cactus) plantations, from which it gets the name "La Nopalera".

Elias is the group's representative.  He tells us that he is 43 years old and married to Teresa.  They have been together for 20 years and have five children who are in school.  Therefore, Elias works hard because his concerned about his children's well-being.  He has been growing "nopals" for 12 years, although the idea for the business came from his wife Teresa.  This time he is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer called manure.  He says he likes to grow "nopales" even though one must be careful when planting them so as not to break the rack, and also in protecting them from the red spider plague, which turns the nopal red and keeps it from producing.    Although this may sound a little alarming for us, Elias says that is not the case since he knows what to do to avoid it.  Elias' biggest problem is money, since he does not have as much to invest as he would like in his nopal crop.  He wants to plant more land and put a structure over his plantation.

Elias' goal is to improve his nopal production and quality.  He is grateful for the loan which has allowed him to increase crop volume, so he not only sells normal nopals, but also as a fruit drink, along with tortilla.  He is using his profits to pay for his children's education, clothing, food and shoes for the entire family.  In general, the entire group is very grateful for the loan, since all the members will be able to buy what they need.  Ponciano will buy fertilizer for his nopal crop, Delgadina will buy vegetables to sell, and Francisca will buy fertilizer for her nopal crop.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Kalikhilikhi Group

texts.en:
Julia is a 37-year-old married woman with five children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the soda business for three years. She started with 50,000 shillings and now has 200,000 shillings as working capital. Julia's challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time. 

Her personal goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand her business into new markets. Julia is a member of the above-mentioned group where each member guarantees the others when they access a loan. Julia wants the loan to buy sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a hard-working married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and to buy a car. She has been operating this piggery project for five years; after starting with two pigs, she now has over 20 pigs. 

Her major challenge is inadequate capital for purchasing feed. However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new markets and hiring employees to help with this expansion. Juliana wants a loan to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg is 26 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Dundgovi province, Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed and their two children are kindergarten students. She started her hairdressing business in 2004. 

Uranchimeg is a certified professional hairdresser who is well-known around the neighborhood. However, her hairdressing equipment is old and her customers are unsatisfied. She is a sharp and hard-working woman who says, "My business is in a very vulnerable place. Since my income is the only income in the family, I need to make it right as soon as possible". She's requesting 3,500,000 MNT to buy new equipment and a large quantity of hair dye and hair cream.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and a large quantity of hair dye and hair cream.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 27-year-old single man. He is employed and earns a low salary which is not enough to cover all his needs and costs. He wants to improve his living conditions by having comfortable home furniture and suitable home appliances, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN. This will help him to cover the costs of purchasing new bedroom furniture and necessary home appliances such as a washing machine and refrigerator. This will provide Khaled with better home living conditions.

Khaled is photographed in his house.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture and some necessary home appliances

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
En el municipio de Larreynaga departamento de león, El señor Pedro se dedica a la actividad comercial desde hace 19 años donde ha diversificado sus actividades, como agropecuarias y compra venta y destace de cerdos, por medio del cual  ha crecido económicamente, con 3 hijos  los que ya son independiente, y su esposa que es la que convive con él en las actividades existentes, a la que tiene el deber de mantener, 
Desde que inicio su negocio El señor Pedro como es la compra y venta de cerdos, se esforzó por mejorar y emprender otra actividad como es la actividad agropecuaria tradición de sus padres, y  hoy poder mantener su nucleo familiar, una de las necesidades es de comprar Cerdos para su actividad como es la compra y venta de cerdos ya que la demanda en esta fecha es muy buena por lo que se acerca  la época de invierno y la gente en el campo lo utiliza para la siembra de primera por eso visito ceprodel para ser beneficiado.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Larreynaga, in the department of León, Pedro has been in business for 19 years, carrying out diverse farm activities, including buying and selling pigs.  He has grown economically, and his three children are now independent.  He and his wife, who is dependent on him, live together and care for the business.

Ever since he started the pig business, Pedro has worked hard to improve and start other farm activities like his parents, to keep the family together.  Buying pigs is important now that the winter season is approaching, because it is when farmers use them in sowing season.  So he has asked Ceprodel for support.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar is 39 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and takes care of their elder disabled son and another two children are in school and kindergarden. 

He started his tire repairing business in 2009. His service location is fairly good and his service is automated. Therefore, its fairly fast. In order to expand his business, he needs a tow car to pick up his customers. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says,"Currently, my income is not enough to support my family. If I could purchase a tow car, I could finally be able to support my family." He is requesting 3,440,000 MNT to purchase a new tow car.

loans.use: to purchase a new tow car.

loans.name: Enhbat

texts.en:
Enhbat is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Dundgovi province, Mongolia. His wife is employed and their two children are kindergarten students. He started his bakery business in 2006. 

Enhbat is a certified professional baker who is well-known across the neighborhood. His products' taste and quality are excellent for a small bakery. However, his products lack packaging, therefore, he is requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan to buy packaging equipment and tags. He is a hard-working young man who says, "I'm losing a lot of customers due to not packaging the products. I believe my sales would increase drastically if I could package my products".

loans.use: To buy packaging equipment and tags

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a 36-year-old man from Kakamega, married to Eunice and they have three children aged 10, seven and three years.

Silas operates an animal sales business, mainly with cattle, and has been doing this for the past 12 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 7,320. Silas is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy more cattle to sell. He will use the profits to repay his loan.

His dream is to expand his business so as to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma  is 49 years old, and live in Congo Town. She is married and has seven children between 14 to 30-years- old. Two children work and live on their own and the rest live at home and attend school. 

For the past ten years she has been running a small shop where she sells charcoal, oil, doughnuts, biscuits, candy, groundnut, rice, and soap. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business allows her to save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, oil, doughnuts, biscuits, candy, groundnut, rice, and soap for her business. Her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, oil, doughnuts, biscuits, candy, groundnut, rice, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Minever M.

texts.en:
Minever is 45 years old and lives in Congo town. She is married with two children, ages 13 and 20, that are in school and live at home. 

For the past five years she has been selling used clothes. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business allows her save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Margaret Njoki

texts.en:
Margaret has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru town and has been a loyal loan borrower from KADET LTD, this being her fifth loan term. She used her previous loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting on her farm. She was able to plant and harvest and it was very profitable. Margaret repaid all the loan amount well and in good time.

She plans to use this loan amount to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings for planting during this rainy season. With the anticipated profits, she plans to increase her cattle stock and thereby boost her dairy farming too.

In the future, Margaret hopes to improve her farming methods and become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 32 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with three children aged between 3 and 13 years old who are in school and live at home. For the past five years, she has been running a shop (salon) where she dresses hair and sells artificial hair. Ruth started this business with money given to her by her husband and the business has helped her to save more money.

Ruth is requesting a loan to purchase more hair products (hair relaxer etc.) and artificial hair (weaves) for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children and to educate them

loans.use: to purchase more hair products (hair relaxer etc.) and artificial hair (weaves) for her business

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en:
Bayaraa is 42 years old and lives with his parents, wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. His wife sells grocery products and his son is a kindergarden student. 

He started his public transportation business in 2008 with his own microbus. Over the years he made it to the most profitable route. Therefore, his income is stable. Also, when his business slows, he helps his wife's grocery products trading business. 

He's requesting 1,300,000 MNT to make decorations for his new house and to buy spare parts for his microbus. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says,"My income is the main income in the family. I just could not afford to lose this route for the sake of my family."

loans.use: to make decorations for his new house and to buy spare parts for his microbus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Hardenia

texts.en: Hardenia  is 38 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married with two children aged five and 12 who live at home and attend school. For the past few years, Hardenia has been selling rice, oil and pepper. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and the business helps her to save more money. Hardenia is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil and pepper for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and pepper for her business

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 30 years old and lives in Congo Town.  She is married with 3 children between 5  to 12 years old.  Her children attend school and live at home.

For years now, she has been selling slipper and lapper (traditional cloths).  She started this business with money given to her by her husband.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more slipper and lapper (traditional cloths) for her business.  Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more slipper and lapper (traditional cloths) for her business

loans.name: Grp1015 Jesuklo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GRP1015 JESUKLO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Yénoukoumè Angèle, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Yénoukoumè Angèle est âgé de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Félicien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Yénoukoumè Angèle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Yénoukoumè Angèle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Yénoukoumè Angèle mène comme activité la vente de condiments, du vin de palme et de produits divers dans son quartier. Yénoukoumè Angèle s'approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Yénoukoumè Angèle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GRP1015 JESUKLO, un  crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The GRP1015 JESUKLO group is formed of three people who live in the same neighborhood.  The representative of the group is Yénoukoumè Angèle, who is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. Yénoukoumè Angèle is 35 years of age and, with her husband Félicien, has four children who are at school and for whom the couple is responsible. Yénoukoumè Angèle lives with her husband and children, and she and her husband are responsible for meeting the household expenses. Yénoukoumè Angèle did not go to school, and works in the sale of seasonings, palm wine and miscellaneous products in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. To ensure customer satisfaction and increase her turnover and income, Yénoukoumè Angèle has asked for an Alidé loan along with the other members of the GRP1015 JESUKLO group.

loans.use: To buy seasonings, palm wine and miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Shinebayar

texts.en:
Shinebayar is twenty-four years old and lives with his wife in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife is on maternity leave. He started his pizza delivery business in 2008. His income is stable. He drives a rented car and therefore, his income is not much. 

He is planning to buy a car, the one he is driving, for 3,500,000 MNT. If he can buy a car, it'll increase his income drastically. He is a sharp young man who says "Now that I'm the only one with the income and I have a baby coming, I need to increase my income in order to support my child".

loans.use: To buy a car.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Nalbandyan village with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Gohar and her family are involved in agriculture. Six years ago they started land cultivation, and three years ago they started cattle breeding. Now they have six cattle on their farm. 

Gohar would like to increase the number of pigs, which is why she has applied for this loan. The development of pig breeding means increased income and a better life for Gohar and her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is fifty-five years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is retired and her daughter is a college student. She started running her grocery shop business in 2008. She's a senior citizen in the neighborhood, therefore, her customers are very pleased to be her customers. Over the years she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. 

Now that her daughter has started college, she needs to expand her shop in order to support her. She's requesting 3,000,000 MNT to repair her shop and to buy a bigger range of products.

loans.use: To repair her shop and to buy a bigger range of products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is fifty years old, and lives in Kakata Town. She has six children between thirteen and thirty-one years old. Two of them live at home and are in school while the oldest ones are out of high school and living on their own. Her husband is a government worker.

For fifteen years she has been selling cosmetics in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. Her plans is to see all her children can get to college.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Tseepil

texts.en:
Tseepil is thirty-seven years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is a technologist in company and her daughter is a school student. She started her tailoring business in 2001. She started off with only one tailoring machine. Now she employs four people and has all the necessary equipment. She has a professional certificate in sewing. She has many regular customers and the quality of her work and her sense of fashion are excellent. 

Now that her business is picking, up she needs to increase her supplies to work efficiently. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "it's very hard to work with limited supplies and I'm starting to lose my customers". She's requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy more sewing materials.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is 48 years old and a married woman. Her husband is a blacksmith. They have four daughters and two sons; three of their daughters have gotten married.

Khitam owns a store located next to a school. She has divided it into many sections; one is books and stationery items, one for selling snacks, and another for selling toys and children’s gifts. 

Khitam has applied for this loan to expand the products she has with more quantity and more items, and to reconfigure the store to separate every section.

loans.use: to reconfigure the store to separate every section

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a conservative married woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Mona, 46 years old and a hard-working mother, has three daughters and a son. The eldest daughter is married.

Mona works during the day in a governmental entity as a cleaner. Yousef, Mona’s husband, is a trader. Using his experience, Mona opened, together with her husband, a small food market to sell sugar, beans, tea bags, etc. During the day, Yousef stays at the store and in the afternoon Mona comes to help him.

Now Mona has applied for this loan to reorganize the store and add more food products to get more revenue.

loans.use: to reorganize the store and add more food products

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 44 years old and a married man, has three children.

Mohammad owns a shop that sells basically herbs, and beside that he has a section selling a few cosmetic products made of oil and herbs.

Today Mohammad has applied for this loan to stock more herbs in the store.

loans.use: to stock more herbs in the store

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah, 24 years old and a single guy, has two brothers and two sisters. He is a third year student at a governmental university majoring in civil engineering. 

Abdallah will be starting to do some training and practicing on what he took in the university next year, but now he has applied tfor this loan in order to pay the upcoming semester fees so he can register and continue to get the practical training that will allow him to graduate so he can be able to find a suitable job in a construction company.

loans.use: to pay the upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is a 41-year-old man who lives with his wife and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife is on maternity leave. Two of his children study at the secondary school. He has been running a freight transportation business since 2003, using his truck.

 In 2007, Batsaihan replaced the truck with a good one. During these 8 years, the business activities have been stable and profitable. He delivers the freight between Ulaanbaatar city and Zavhan province. 

Batsaihan is an honest man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing some beef and mutton in large quantities. I am planning to sell the meat to regular clients in Ulaanbaatar city." The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy  meat.

loans.use: To buy  beef and mutton in large quantities

loans.name: Abdulraman

texts.en:
This is Abdulraman, a small-scale businessman in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. For the past 20 years Abdulraman has been selling shoes, etc. and is now requesting a loan of 5,000,0000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) to buy a large variety of shoes to add to his existing stock.

Abdulraman’s wife is also a businesswoman, and his two children are attending primary schools.

loans.use: to buy a large variety of shoes to add to his existing stock.

loans.name: Yarmah

texts.en: Yarmah is 40 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She’s married but did not go to school. With a little income from her husband she engaged in a small business, and she has been in this business for 29 years now. She enjoys the flow of her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, peppers and many items for her business. Her dream is to own a house in the nearest future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, peppers and many items for her business

loans.name: Olohountobi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OLOHOUNTOBI est formé de cinq personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Mariama, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Mariama est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Saïd. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mariama n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a une dizaine d’année, Mariama vend des bijoux de façon ambulante. Mariama s’approvisionne au Nigeria. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Mariama désire obtenir un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OLOHOUNTOBI. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Olohountobi group is formed of five people who all live in the same neighborhood. Mariama is the group representative, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. This is the second time that this group has requested financial support from Alidé to expand their activity. Mariama is 34 years of age and is married to Saïd, with whom she has four children, all of whom are at school and for whom the couple is responsible. Mariama did not attend school, and for the past ten years she has worked as an itinerant vendor selling jewelry. Mariama gets her supplies from Nigeria. To increase her product stock and better meet the needs of her customers, she decided to apply for a second loan from Alidé with the rest of the members of the Olohountobi group. Their first loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: To buy jewelry.

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Erdenetsogt is a 47-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her two children are independent. She started retailing shock absorbers in 2000 with her husband. He sells them at a local market. They have made a number of regular customers. They attract the buyers because of their good prices and qualified products. 

Erdenetsogt is a diligent woman who says, "I am planning to expand the business activities by purchasing supplies in large quantities. In order to make it happen, I need some support."  The total amount she is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy more supplies.

loans.use: To buy more supplies

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 30-year-old lady from Kisumu and is married to Thomas. They have two children, aged three and one years.

Jane is a tailor and has been doing this for the last five years. She makes a monthly income of KES. 12,500. She is currently taking out her second loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy a stock of textile materials. Jane will use her profits to pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to expand her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of textile materials

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Haja is approximately thirty-three years old. She was born in Freetown but now lives in Koidu city in eastern Sierra Leone with her husband and four children. Haja has been a businesswoman for eleven years now. She sells clothes, foodstuffs, mobile phones, etc. 

Haja has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from Kiva field partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) in order to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock. In this way, her business will improve both in size and quality, attracting many customers to her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, foodstuffs, mobile phones, etc. wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Jargal is a 59-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is a retiree. One of the children studies at secondary school. She has been running a construction materials retail business since 2004. She sells them at a local trade center which is the biggest market center in the eastern part of the city. She purchases the supplies from China. 

Jargal is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to develop the business by increasing the types of products. I am planning to buy some minor equipment." The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy more construction materials.

loans.use: To buy more construction materials

loans.name: Unurbat

texts.en:
Unurbat is a 34-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife is employed and his children study at the secondary school. He has been running production of traditional hats since 2007. He started the business by using an old sewing machine and now he is a successful entrepreneur. He has made regular customers.

Unurbat is a talented man in his field and says, "I would like to develop the business activities by purchasing the necessary materials for the business." The total amount he is requesting is 300,000 MNT to buy necessary materials.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials

loans.name: Ama-Dou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AMA-DOU est formé de trois personnes qui viennent du même village. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Abibatou, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Abibatou est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Issifou. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Abibatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Abibatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a près d’une dizaine d’année que Abibatou mène comme activité la vente de "côme" (pâte faite à base du maïs) accompagné de sauce aux poissons dans un parc au Benin. Abibatou s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Abibatou sollicite pour la sixième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AMA-DOU.
texts.en: The AMA-DOU group is formed of three people who come from the same village. Abibatou is the representative of this group, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. This is the sixth time that this group has requested the financial support of Alidé to expand their activity. Abibatou is 41 years of age and married to Issifou. The couple has three children, all at school, for whom they are responsible. Abibatou did not go to school, and lives with her husband and children. Both she and her husband are responsible for the household expenses. For almost ten years Abibatou has sold "côme" (a type of corn mash) with fish sauce in a park in Benin, and she gets her supplies from a market in the city. To increase customer satisfaction and ensure greater income, Abibatou has requested a sixth loan from Alidé along with the other members of the AMA-DOU group.

loans.use: To buy corn, seasonings and fresh fish.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu lives in Kakata Town. She is 43 years old and she stopped her education in 6th grade. She is married and has four children between 7 and 27 years old that are in school and live at home. Her husband is a driver. For ten years now she has been selling rice and palm oil  in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business. She started her business with money given to her by her husband. She is happy about her business  because of the profit she makes per day. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town,is married to Samuel and they have three children.

She plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for planting during this planting season.With the anticipated profits she plans to plant more crops and make more income.

In the future, Ann hopes expand her farming and plant on a large scale and increase her income, hence improving the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds for planting

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa is a 44-year-old divorced woman who lives with her 2 children in a suburban area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her younger child studies at the secondary school. She started her boot-repair business in 1992. She has been running the business successfully since that time. The business activities are stable and profitable. She is planning to develop the business activities by having some financial support. 

Bolormaa is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activities by purchasing some modern equipment for the business." The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy equipment for her boot-repair business.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her boot-repair business

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is 37 years old, comes from Ndunyu Njeru, and is married with three children who are aged between nine and 20 years old. 

Felista is a farmer and has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy fertilizers, seedlings and pay for labor.

The profits made from this business will enable her to pay school fees for her children and also uplift her living standard. She hopes to expand the farm to boost her income in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and pay for labor

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 25 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, Robert has been working hard to manage his small business in cosmetics sales. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetic lotions for resale and will help Robert to earn greater profits. Additionally, he will be able to meet his family's needs such as paying the school fees for his child. In the future, Robert hopes to own a wholesale shop. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic lotions for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 40 years old and lives in Kakata. She is married and has three children who are in school and live at home. 

Rebecca did not go to school. She received start-up capital from her husband to start her food market business. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She enjoys the flow of her customers. 

Rebecca is requesting a loan to buy more bitter ball (a tropical vegetable with a bitter taste), okra, peppers, rice and oil for her business. Her dream is to become a homeowner in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bitter ball (a tropical vegetable with a bitter taste), okra, peppers, rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 41 years old and from Naivasha. He is married to Nancy and they have two children.

James has a butcher shop that he has been running for the past three years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to renovate his business premises. 

James hopes to open other butcheries in his town.

loans.use: to renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 34 years old and married. He is blessed with a 5-year-old child. He sells different types of goods. He started this business 13 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 14,000. 

Jackson has requested a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase key holders, socks and belts for sale. The profit he earns will help him purchase more stock for his business. 

His dream is to be a successful businessman. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase key holders, socks and belts for sale.

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.ru: Рачабмурод целеустремленный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет пятерых детей. Последние 5 лет он занимается  выращиванием и продажей сельхозпродуктов. Он выращивает лук и картофель. Имеет 2 гектара земли для посева. Рачабмурод хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян лука и картофеля для посева. Рачабмурод надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Rajabmurod is a goal-oriented and hard-working person. He is married and raising five children. For the last five years, he has been growing produce for sale. He grows onions and potatoes. He hast two hectares [about 5 acres] of farming land. Rajabmurod would like to receive a loan to buy onion and potato seeds for planting. Rajabmurod is hoping for your kind help.

loans.use: to buy onion and potato seeds.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 34 years old, married and blessed with two children, ages 13 and 6 years respectively. She is a hawker who sells different types of goods. She started this business 7 years ago and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

She has requested a loan worth 15,000 KES to purchase handkerchiefs, socks, and ladies handbags for sale. The profit she earns will help her purchase more stock for her business. 

Her dream is to succeed in life. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase handkerchiefs, socks, and women's handbags for sale.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is unmarried and has been a rice farmer for four years. He would like to request a loan to buy seeds and to support labor costs so that he may achieve the best possible harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using in order to get more output.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and buy seeds

loans.name: Mwesige

texts.en:
Mwesige is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Mwesige has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Mwesige has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Mwesige to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Mwesige hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger boutique. 

Mwesige is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Mwesige, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale,

loans.name: Jaques

texts.en:
Jacques has been a rice farmer for 40 years. He and his wife, who is also a farmer, have five children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Jacques would like to request this loan to buy seeds and to support labor costs in order to get the best possible harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using in order to get more output.

 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 40 years old, married and blessed with four children between the ages of 6 and 13 years old. He owns an electronics repair shop, a business he started 7 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 40,000 KES. 

He has requested a loan worth 30,000 KES to purchase a computer and other mobile phone accessories. The anticipated profit will help him open another branch of his business. 

He dreams of being a successful businessman. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a married father of seven children between the ages of 7 and 17. Three of them are enrolled in school, while two others have abandoned education, and the other two are still young.

Married to a farmer, Pascal has been a rice farmer for 14 years and is requesting this loan to buy seeds and pay labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to increase production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is single. He has been a rice farmer for 10 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and pay for labor costs in rice production.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married and has three children age 4 to 12. All of them are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for ten years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs and seeds for rice production.

loans.name: Shar

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Shar. Born in Koidu city, the husband and father of four children is a small-scale businessman. Shar’s wife is a businesswoman and his children are all attending primary or secondary schools. 

Shar sells coffee, cocoa, cola nuts, palm-oil, etc. He has been a businessman for 18 years now. However, Shar’s business has been growing at a very slow pace due to the lack of sufficient capital. 

Thus he has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan in order to expand his business. Shar wants a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL). With this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy coffee, cocoa, cola nuts, palm-oil, etc. at wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
Aaron is married and has three children between 8 and 15 years old. All of them are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for five years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.
