The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for the seeds and support labor costs.

loans.name: Odilia

texts.en:
Odilia is married and has five children. She lives in Musang, Bamenda, Northwest region, Cameroon. She lives with the entire family in a two-bedroom house.

The loss of her two elder brothers was one of the most difficult moments in her life, and now there is too much dependence on her. She also has to face the difficulty of educating the family members.   

Odilia has benefited from loans from GHAPE three times, and this will be the fourth time she is benefiting from a loan from GHAPE. Odilia has been in GHAPE since 2007 and has been very successful in past businesses. 

She plans to use her loan in the purchase and resale of second-hand motor parts. She thinks this business will succeed because she has so many customers and also because people in her community prefer second-hand motor parts since they are cheaper.   

She intends using the proceeds of this business to pay her children's school fees, buy some basic needs for the family, build her house and solve some of her family problems.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multifaceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to pay for auto spare parts.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is married and has four children. She lives in Travelers, Bamenda, Northwest region, Cameroon. She lives with the entire family in a three-bedroom house.

The loss of her father and elder sister was one of the most difficult moments in her life, which brought general poverty to the family, causing her to drop out of school, thus making dependence on her too much. She also has faced the difficulty of educating the family members.   

Glory has benefited from loans from GHAPE four times and this will be the fifth time she is benefiting from a loan from GHAPE. Glory has been in GHAPE since 2005 and has been very successful in past businesses. 

She plans to use her loan in the purchase and resale of firewood, the production and sale of yogurt, and poultry and piggery farming. She thinks this  business will succeed because she has so many customers and also because of the ever-increasing demand for these products.   

She intends to use the proceeds of this business to pay her children's school fees, buy some basic needs for the family, build her house and solve some of her family's problems.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to pay for chicks, piglets, firewood and dairy products.

loans.name: Aweno

texts.en:
Aweno is 36 years old, married to a businesswoman and the father of two children aged 14 and 2 years. For the past two years Aweno has been passionately provided transport services to his customers while also growing and selling fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, passion fruits, etc. to increase his daily income.

His business is located within a busy town, where his main business challenge is the mechanical upkeep of the motorbike. Aweno is therefore requesting his first loan loan of Kes 20,000 to add to his savings to buy another motorcycle to increase his transportation services. With the anticipated profits, he hopes to purchase a vehicle for personal transportation.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Airforce Group

texts.en:
Cesilia, who is in her 40s, is single with eight grown-up children.  She has been selling firewood for one year now.  She works from 6 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to increase her firewood stock to resell.  Her dream is to one day be able to sell charcoal.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Airforce," which has a total of 16 members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase firewood stock to resell

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 2 Group

texts.en:
Lourdes is the coordinator of her group El Sol Sale Para Todos (The Sun Shines For Everyone) 2 & 3. The members of the group are located in the city of Hato Mayor, a small and rural community. Lourdes lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and she has seven children. She said her most difficult challenge has been to provide for her children and to educate them. One of her favorite things to do is to work.

Lourdes is excited about her 13th loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for approximately seven years, starting with the first loan she received from Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing sales by purchasing pants, skirts, shirts, blouses and other pieces. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. Lourdes thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Fatmata, a small-scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to invest in her businesses. 

A wife and a mother of three children, the 28-year-old woman was born in Kono. She sells building materials. She has been doing this business for eight years now. 

Fatmata has requested this loan in order to buy cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc., to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cement iron corrugated zinc etc., to add to her business.

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 1 Group

texts.en:
Antonia is the coordinator of her group El Sol Sale Para Todos (The Sun Shines For Everyone) 1, whose members are located in the city of Hato Mayor, a small rural community. Antonia, who makes her home there in a simple structure with her husband, says that her most difficult challenge has been to improve her business, something she continues to work very hard at. In the meantime, she plans to continue attending to the church.

With her first Esperanza loan almost seven years ago, Antonia started her business, a "Fantasia" selling miscellanous products. She is now requesting her 12th loan which she will use to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, women´s accessories and others product. Antonia and her group thank you for your help in achieving their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products (shoes, cosmetics, accessories, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Fallah

texts.en:
Fallah was born in Sandor, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is now 35 years of age. His wife is a businesswoman. Fallah has been a businessman for 14 years now. 

Fallah sells clothes, jewelry, watches, etc., in Koidu city. He wants a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) to enable him to improve on his business. With a loan, Fallah will be able to add more clothes, jewelry, watches, etc., in his business. This will eventually lead to more sales and improve profit. Fallah will thus be able to take better care of his child and wife.

loans.use: to buy clothes, jewelry, watches, etc., to add to his business.

loans.name: Shaba Group

texts.en:
Joel, who is in his early 30s, is single.  He has one child, who goes to school.  He has had a motorcycle for two years now.  He works from 8 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy spare parts for his motorcycle, start a local chicken business, and manage household expenses.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy more local chicken and spare parts for his motorcycle. His dream is to one day be able to own a retail shop.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Shaba," which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more local chicken and spare parts for a motorcycle

loans.name: Sunguchini Group

texts.en:
Donath, who is in her mid-40s, is married and has two children who go to school. She has been running a retail shop for seven years now. She works from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock her store, to pay for household expenses, and to begin building her house. She has paid back all of her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase the shop inventory. Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Sunguchini," which has a total of 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory.

loans.name: Azizi Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her mid-30s, is married and has two children who are still going to school. She has been a food vendor since 2010. She works from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock items, buy a TV set and radio, and pay for household expenses. She has paid back all loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase the food inventory in order to sell more food. Her dream is to one day own a hotel.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Azizi," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her food inventory

loans.name: Agabagahya Kitooka Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 45-year-old married man with eight children living in Masindi, Uganda. For the past five years he has been operating a retail shop, with price fluctuations and inadequate capital as his main business challenges.

A member of Agabagahya Kitooka Group, whose members guarantee each other's loans, Ibrahim is requesting this loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap to sell. His dreams are to educate his children and diversify his business.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres De Debora 2 Group

texts.en:
Luz Maria is one of the members of the group Mujeres de Debora 2. This group is located in the city of Puerto Plata, whose population is made up of Dominicans and Haitian migrants. The region's economy is dependent on the rum industry, as well as tourism and real estate. This is Luz Maria's seventh loan with Esperanza. She is running a Colmado (a small grocery store) and she will invest in her business by buying rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, and other goods.

Luz Maria has been operating a business for approximately three years, and she started with her first loan in Esperanza. She is the mother of three children. While she worked in different jobs and made various businesses, she saved her profits and helped her husband. She tells us that her most difficult challenge was to pay for her children's education, especially when hard times were coming. One of Luz Maria's dreams is to travel to another country.

Luz Maria thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa es una mujer que tiene 27  años de edad, de estado civil casada, con dos  hijos,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijos. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Tomasa vive en  el caserío Estancia Chica del distrito del Olmos del  departamento de  Lambayeque, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica, posta médica, colegio, iglesia;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Tomasa es la crianza/venta de ganado porcino , ovinos  y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Tomasa cuenta con 7 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ell  vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  0.5  has de cultivo de limón lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico y donde viene realizando cosechas semanalmente, de donde le permite tener otro ingresos. 
Actualmente  Tomasa se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.3,000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceado y compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a 27-year-old woman who is married and has 2 children. She lives in her own house with her husband and her children. The quality of life in her community is subsistence level. The majority of residents are independent workers dedicated to commerce and raising smaller farm animals, while some also farm. Tomasa lives in Estancia Chica in Olmos district, Lambayeque department. She has only basic electrical services; there is also a medical outpost, a school, and a church. All the families who reside there live under these same conditions.

Tomasa's commercial activity is raising and selling pigs, sheep, and chickens in corrals alongside her house. It bears mentioning that she has 7 years experience in the business. Tomasa sells her animals to wholesale merchants in the zone. In addition, she has cropland with 0.5 hectares planted in lemon trees, which are in attractive condition and can be harvested weekly, offering an additional source of income.

At present, Tomasa wants to expand her inventory of animals to raise and sell, since this is a very profitable activity in the zone. That's why she is requesting a new loan through Edpyme Alternativa for the sum of 3,000 new sols, to purchase animal feed plus fertilizers for her lemon trees. In time, this should allow her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy commercial feed for fattening her sheep plus fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Julia Veronica

texts.es: La señora Julia es habitante de un poblado de telica departamento de león, su profesión es maestra de primaria de un colegio de la localidad con 22 años de impartir clases a los niños que tiene a su cargo, ya que con los años de laborar a penetrado en varias generaciones donde sembró la semilla del saber, es casada con 3 hijos los que tiene que brindarle las condiciones para su desarrollo, actualmente presenta una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda  la que está en mal estado, por tal necesidad se decidió de visitar a ceprodel y solicitar un financiamiento para lograr el objetivo percibido, de mejorar el techo y pared, ya que el financiamiento lo utilizara para  la compra de materiales como, ladrillos, cemento, hierro ¼, hierro 3/8, piedrín, arena, perlin, zinc, alambre de amarre, azulejos, ayudante y ano  de obra.
texts.en:
Julia lives in a village in Telica in the León department.  She is an elementary school teacher in her village, and she has 22 years of experience teaching the children under her care.  In the years that she has worked she has reached various generations where she planted the seed of knowledge.

She is married and has three children to whom she needs to provide the conditions for their development.  She currently needs to improve her house, which is in a bad state.  

Because of this necessity she decided to visit Ceprodel and ask for a loan.  The loan is to improve the roof and wall.  She will use the loan to buy materials like bricks, cement, ¼ iron, ¾ iron, gravel, zinc sheeting, wire ties, and glazed tiles.  She will also pay for a helper and labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like bricks, cement, ¼ iron, ¾ iron, gravel, zinc sheeting, wire ties, and glazed tiles.  She will also pay for a helper and labor.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en: Enock is a 47-year-old married man with three children, living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been dealing in produce for ten years. The hardships his business faces are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock. Enock's personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to expand his business into new markets. Enock is requesting a loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Alejandro Sandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es un hombre muy trabajador y sobre todo optimista, vive al lado de su esposa quien lo apoya mucho y al lado de su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad, al cual quiere muchísimo y es lo más importante para él; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, así como también por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz y también por los riquísimos camarones. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio y aprovecha para comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Chupe de camarones; el solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Mecánica Automotriz.

Día a día Alejandro sale a trabajar con mucho entusiasmo en su negocio como chofer de taxi; él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 60 clientes diariamente; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable cuando conduce y por ello los clientes se sienten más seguros con él.

Alejandro está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar llantas para su vehículo, con esta mejora evitara tener accidentes y podrá seguir manejando con seguridad, tanto para él como para los clientes; así el seguirá trabajando cada día hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” “Comprarse un terreno para construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a very hard-working man, and above all he is optimistic.  He lives with his wife, who supports him a lot, and his two year old son.  He loves his son very much, and his son is what is most important to him.  His house is in the city of Camana.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches.  It is also known for its agriculture, especially for growing rice; and for its delicious shrimp.

When he has free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors.  He takes the opportunity to eat one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “Chupe de Camarones” (shrimp chowder).  He only went to high school, but he would have liked to have studied auto mechanics.

Alejandro leaves for work day to day with great enthusiasm in his business as a taxi driver.  He devotes around 12 hours a day to his business.  He can serve 60 customers a day.  He believes that it is going well in his business because he is very responsible when he drives.  Therefore, the customers feel safer with him.

Alejandro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have provided he will be able to buy tires for his vehicle.  With this improvement he will avoid having accidents.  He will also be able to continue driving safely, as much for himself as for his customers.  This way he will continue working every day to make his biggest dream come true:  Buying a piece of land to build his house.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 45 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her four children. She desires to educate her children up to university level and set up an income-generating activity for each one of them. 
Regina is requesting a loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts for resale. She deals in produce and this business has enabled her to support her family, despite challenges in terms of inadequate capital to purchase sufficient stock.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 47 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. As a farmer, Regina saved some money and started a produce business. Her family dream is to educate her children and expand her business into new markets. She is requesting a loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 30 years old, married to Isabella and is blessed with a four-year-old son. He owns a service shop where he charges batteries and mobile phones for a fee. He started this business two years ago and earns a monthly income of 31,000 KES. 
Charles has requested his first loan of 30,000 KES to purchase another battery-charging machine. The anticipated profits will help him repay his loan. He dreams of being successful through his loans from Kiva partner, KADET.

loans.use: to purchase a new battery-charging machine.

loans.name: Perpetuah

texts.en:
Perpetuah is a 32-year-old businesswoman in Mombasa. She sells clothes, a business she has had success with for the last four years. She is married and a mother of three children.

This is her second business loan from KADET; she plans to purchase more wrappers, blouses and skirts for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest into her business.  Perpetuah hopes to excel in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more wrappers, blouses and skirts.

loans.name: Jeska

texts.en:
Jeska is a 27-year-old hardworking woman who lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her four children and her dream is to see them through school. 
Jeska is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for her farm. She has a piggery project, which has been very productive. Her business dream is to expand the project further.

loans.use: to buy piglets for rearing.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 34-year-old clothes dealer in Mombasa. He has been in this business for the past 12 years and has met with success. He is married and is a father of two. 
This loan marks his fourth business loan from Kiva partner KADET to finance his business. He plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers to boost his stock for resale. He will use the anticipated profits to open another clothes shop and repay his loan. He hopes to excel in the business and in life.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, skirts, dresses and trousers.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is an ambitious 22-year-old single mother of one child living in Masindi-Uganda.  After dropping out of school due to an unwanted pregnancy, her parents gave her capital to start a salon. She hopes to educate her child and move her business to a more permanent location.  Hadija faces challenges in the seasonal nature of her business.  Hadijah requests a loan to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a single man, aged 37. He supports three members of his family. 
Peter is a newspaper vendor in Kaptumo and has been in this business for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES. He is now servicing a third loan of 50,000 KES from Kiva partner KADET and intends to use this amount to pay the newspaper suppliers. His earnings from his business will be used to repay the loan and improve his living standards. His dream is to succeed in business and own a family home.

loans.use: to pay the newspaper suppliers.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon is a 27-year-old woman with four children, and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She has been dealing in second-hand clothes for three years now. High fuel and transportation costs coupled with inflation hinder her business, Sharon desires to educate her children and expand her business into new markets. She needs a loan to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 30 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of her five children since her husband only spends his money on drinking alcohol.
Angelina wants a loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts for resale. She saved some money from her wages as a casual labourer and started a produce business. Her family dream is to educate her children and expand her business into new markets.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Wanyina Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANYINA est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même zone. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Abossèdé Gisèle, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Abossèdé Gisèle est mariée à un certain Emmanuel. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Abossèdé Gisèle assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Abossèdé Gisèle a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et vend divers produits (sucre, lait, etc.) et du jus de bissap depuis près de vingt cinq ans. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Abossèdé Gisèle désire augmenter son stock de produits. Pour ce faire, Abossèdé Gisèle sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANYINA, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The WANYINA group is made up of three people who live in the same area.

Abossèdé Gisèle, who is raising her hand in the photograph, is the group's representative. This is the first time that this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to expand their business. Abossèdé Gisèle is married to a man named Emmanuel. The couple has five children, all of whom have received schooling. Abossèdé Gisèle covers the various household expenses with her husband.

Abossèdé Gisèle stopped her studies in secondary school and has been selling various products (sugar, milk, etc.) and bissap juice for almost five years now. Striving to better satisfy her customers and increase her revenue, Abossèdé Gisèle wants to increase her inventory of products. To do so, Abossèdé Gisèle is seeking, along with the other members of the WANYINA group, a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy various products (sugar, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 29-year-old food stall owner in Barsheba, Mombasa. He is single, and his business has been in operation for the past three years with great success. 

This marks his second borrowing from KADET to finance his business. He plans to purchase assorted foodstuffs and serving dishes. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business further and repay his loan. He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted foodstuffs and serving dishes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose wants a loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell. She is 48 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda.

From farming, she saved some money and started a produce business. Her family dream is to educate her children and expand her business to new markets. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her four children.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 53-year-old married retail shop owner in Mariakani. She has been a shopkeeper for the past year and her business is doing great. 

This is Mary's second loan from KADET to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and washing detergents as stock for her business. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further and to repay her loan. She hopes to have a well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and washing detergents.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 31-year-old married woman with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. She is a market vendor and has been in this business for eight years. High fuel and transportation costs coupled with theft hinder her business; however, she desires to educate her children and diversify her business by including a number of food stuffs.  Sarah wants a loan to buy tomatoes, beans and potatoes for resale.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, beans and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 32 years old, married and the father of one child. For the last three years, he has earned a living by hawking his wares in Malindi, and he earns a monthly profit of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers. He is applying for his second loan of KES 32,000 to buy additional stock such as soft drinks, packed biscuits, hair combs, mirrors and sweets to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay his child's school fees. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for his business such as soft drinks, packed biscuits, hair combs, mirrors and sweets.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 33 years old, married to Faith and blessed with two children, ages 4 and 2.   He owns a general spares shop, a business he started eight years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 80,000. 

He has requested his first loan from KADET for KES 30,000 to purchase products to refill gas and other required equipment; the anticipated profit will help him expand his business. He dreams of being a successful businessman and creating jobs for youth.

loans.use: to purchase products to refill gas and other required equipment.

loans.name: Kholbi

texts.ru: Холби проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Холби арендует торговую точку на рынке, где занимается торговлей тканей. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки других расцветок и видов тканей.
texts.en: Kholbi resides in the Dangara region. She is 47 years old, married, and has five children. Kholbi rents retail space at the market where she sells fabrics. She has been engaged in this for the past three years. She is taking this loan to purchase fabrics of additional types and patterns.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics of different types and patterns

loans.name: Boldukan

texts.ru: Болдукан –участница группы Терек -4. Болдукан 43 года. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, Болдукан занимается животноводством. Болдукан имеет в хозяйстве 2 дойные коровы с телятами и 1 лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Болдукан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Болдукан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Boldukan is a member of the Terek-4 group. She is 43 years old. To provide for her family, Boldukan raises livestock. She has 2 dairy cows with calves and a horse. In oder to continue developing her business, Boldukan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Tecla is a married, 45 year-old lady blessed with seven children between 22 and 7 years old.  She buys fresh green tea leaves from the local farmers which she sells directly to the factory.  She has been working as the middleman in this business for a period of over 10 year, earning a monthly income of Ksh 20,000. 

She is requesting her third term loan of Ksh 50,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase more fresh green tea leaves for resale.  The profits will be used to repay the loan and plow back into the business. She hopes to prosper in her business and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Sunatullo

texts.ru: Сунатулло житель города Вахдат. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Сунатулло более пяти лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он арендует помещение, где открыл магазин мужской и женской одежды. Также он занимается торговлей обуви. Кредит берет для приобретения женской одежды и сезонной обуви.
texts.en: Sunatullo lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 25 years old, married, and has three children. For over five years, Sunatullo has been selling goods at the local market. He rents retail space where he runs a store that sells men's and women's clothing, as well as footwear. He is taking this loan to purchase women's clothing and seasonal shoes.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing and seasonal footwear

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia wants a loan to buy sugar, salt, rice and soap to sell. She is a 32-year-old single mother with a child living in Masindi, Uganda. The responsibility of taking care of her daughter solely depends on her as the father has another family elsewhere. 

In order to support herself, she started a retail shop and it has sustainably enabled her to have all the basics. She desires to educate her child and move the business to a more permanent location despite the challenges of thieves and price fluctuations.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice and soap to sell.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly wants a loan to pay school fees for her children. She is a forty year-old widow with two children, living in Masindi-Uganda. The responsibility of taking care of her family rests soley on her, and her dream is to see them graduate. She runs a photo studio and she took over the business after her husband's death. She desires to modernize her studio and diversify the business to include a stationery shop. She is challenged by customers not paying on time, and the seasonal nature of the business that makes it hard to project the profits.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Costeñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COSTEÑITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Virginia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de gorras, artesanías, tejido de chompas, venta de comida.

La señora Virginia,  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora y sus compañeras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en chamarras, que inicio hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus compañeras de grupo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela), que compraran de la ciudad de El Alto y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y el área de salud.
texts.en:
This will be the first loan cycle that the communal bank “COSTEÑITAS” will have with Pro Mujer in Senkata. The group has seven members, and Virginia heads its board. The communal bank members pursue a variety of businesses: managing a local store, selling caps and handicrafts, knitting sweaters, and selling food. Virginia says that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, which she is joining at the invitation of an adviser and her partners. Years ago she started her current business making ponchos after learning the craft from her companions.

This loan will increase working capital to buy cloth, which will be purchased in the city of El Alto and later tailored to meet customer orders. Virginia is married and has three children, and this work means she can support her family as much as she can. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she liked saving and the institution's health center.

loans.use: to buy cloth.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 30 years old, married, and has four children. She owns a cereals store, which has been in operation for 10 years.  Viola earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.  

Viola is requesting her third loan for 50,000 KES from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase bags of dry maize to sell.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize to sell.

loans.name: Bainomugisa Katumba Group

texts.en:
Fred is a 29-year-old married man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. He deals in produce, specifically maize, beans, and millet flour. He started the business with the proceeds from two acres of maize three years ago. His dream is to educate his children and build a permanent house. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital affect his business.

His business goals are to expand the business into new markets and buy land to grow crops.

Fred wants a loan to buy maize, beans, and millet flour to sell.

He is a member of the Bainomugisa Katumba group, where members guarantee each other in order to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, and millet flour to sell.

loans.name: Joe Liaina

texts.en:
Joe Liaina is a 34-year-old single man. He has a small plantation and grows roses and other different kinds of fresh flowers to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years. 

Joe Liaina has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a rake, spade, knife, and new flowers. 

He has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With his profits, he hopes to build his own place in town to display and sell flowers to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase growing supplies to grow flowers for sale.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo, 50 years old, lives in the mountainous region of Isabela. He has been engaged in the farming business for 35 years. His father taught him to manage their farm when he was young. Now he has adopted his father's knowledge about how to have good production of his crops. Rodolfo is asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy fertilizer and seed for his farm to have additional income to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his business

loans.name: Savarn's Group

texts.en: Savarn is 54 years old and widowed with two sons. One of her sons works as a motor-taxi driver. For the last thirty years, Savarn has sold fish and vegetables to support her family. She also grows rice on a rice field. Her main obstacle is having enough capital for the fish and vegetables selling business. Savarn could earn around six US dollars per day to feed her family. She has been with VisionFund since 2011 and has completely and regularly repaid all her obligations to VisionFund. She is now requesting a third loan and acts as a leader of a loan group of four members, all of whom are female. Savarn plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds and to hire others to plough and cultivate her rice field. She hopes the loan will enable her to earn more income to feed her family better and especially to expand her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds and to hire others to cultivate a rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eesta is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, yams, and vegetables that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

Eseta is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer, knives, rakes, and weed killer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Eseta will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy  es una mujer que tiene 33  años de edad, de estado civil casada, con tres  hijos,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijos. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Nancy vive en  el caserío San Francisco del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Nancy es la crianza de ganado vacuno , venta de leche  y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Nancy cuenta con 03 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende su leche en el mercado de Tambogrande; Así mismo su cónyuge tiene 2.0 has de terreno agrícola donde tiene instalado cultivo de arroz ,lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico y donde viene realizando cosechas semanalmente, de donde le permite tener otro ingresos. 
Actualmente Nancy se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de leche, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceado y fertilizantes para su cultivo de arroz; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Nancy’s a 33 year old, married woman with three children living in her own house with her husband and children.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in her community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers who are merchants or raise small farm animals; some of them work in agriculture.  

Nancy lives in the San Francisco settlement in Tambogrande District in Piura Department; she only has electricity.  All families living there do so under these conditions.

Nancy’s commercial activity is raising cattle and selling milk and barnyard fowl.  She raises the animals in corrals outside her house.  It’s worth pointing out that Nancy has 3 years’ experience which has allowed her to retain her business’ regular clientele.  She sells the milk in the market in Tambogrande.  In addition, her spouse has a 2.0 hectare plot of farmland where he’s planted rice which is developing properly and where he’s been harvesting weekly thus earning additional income.

Nancy has decided to increase her inventory with regard to raising animals and selling milk because this is a very profitable activity in her area which is why she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a new loan in the amount of 1500 new soles to buy nutritionally balanced feed and fertilizer for the rice crops which in time will make it possible for her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Aniva

texts.en:
Aniva is 38 years old and married with 4 children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro and cocoa samoa that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 5 years. Aniva needs a loan to buy fertilizer, knives, a rake, cocoa plants and plastic bags. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Aniva will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for growing taro and cocoa

loans.name: Faaloia

texts.en:
Faaloia is 34 years old and married. She runs a business selling snacks, soft drinks, freezer stocks, and other goods in her community, which she has been doing for five years. 

Faaloia is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more stock for her shop. She plans to use her profits for home improvement and relocating her business from her village to town. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Fagalua

texts.en:
Susana is a 49-year-old single woman with 2 children. 

She would like to start buying more chickens for the farm to earn a living. Susana has requested a loan to purchase wire to make a fence for the chicken farm. She has been a member of SPBD for 2 years. Susana will spend her profits for her home improvement and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase wire for fencing for her chicken farm

loans.name: Amalia Ivoon

texts.es: Esta señora es originario de un poblado de larreynaga, donde tiene su negocio de comedor y refresquería, el que ejercer desde hace varios años en conjunto con su mama, está casada no tiene hijos ahorita, ha sido cliente de ceprodel siendo beneficiada con créditos los que le han sido de gran impacto, ya que con los mismos ha mejorado sus condiciones del local  y por ende brindar un mejor servicio, ya que la inversión que efectuaría con el financiamiento recibido de ceprodel seria para construir 2 Inodoros y una pila séptica para tener las necesidades básicas dentro de la infraestructura de mejor servicio al cliente y tener una mejor Higiene, con ese objetivo se acerco a ceprodel para realizar tan importante obra, la que sería de gran impacto , solicitando un financiamiento y continuar realizando obras.
texts.en:
This lady is from the town of Larreynaga where she has her eatery and snack bar business that she’s been operating for several years with her mother.  She’s married but does not have any children at present.  She’s been a Ceprodel client and has benefitted from loans that have had a big impact because she’s used them to improve the conditions of her locale thus offering better service.  

The investment she’ll make with the Ceprodel loan received will be to build two toilets and a septic tank in order to have basic services inside the infrastructure for better customer service and better hygiene.  

With this goal in mind, she approached Ceprodel to carry out such an important project that would be of high impact asking for a loan to continue building.

loans.use: to buy toilets, bricks, sand, window and door frames, metal sheeting and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel   es una mujer que tiene 45  años de edad, de estado civil casada, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive con su cónyuge en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Isabel vive en  el caserío San Martín del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de Piura; así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio básico de energía eléctrica; también se menciona que en este caserío viven todas las  familias bajo estas condiciones.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Isabel  es la venta de pescado fresco al por  mayor y menor  en el cual atiende los días viernes, sábados, domingos y lunes en un puesto del mercado de abastos de la zona, complementariamente se dedica a la crianza de animales menores  como  aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Isabel cuenta con 15 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.0  has de cultivo de arroz lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico y también le apoya arduamente en sus actividades que realiza, existiendo una buena relación familiar entre ellos. 
Actualmente Isabel se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su negocio de venta de pescado fresco al por mayor, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo por un monto de S/. 3500 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de pescado fresco  y compra de materiales para su negocio (cubetas, hielo, cuchillos, otros); lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir creciendo su negocio e ir mejorando su nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 45 year old, married woman with two children living in her own house with her husband and children.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in her community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers who are merchants or raise small farm animals; some of them work in agriculture.  


Isabel lives in the San Martín settlement in Tambogrande District in Piura Department; she only has electricity.  All families living there do so under these conditions.

The commercial activity Isabel carries out is selling fresh fish at retail and wholesale.  She works Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Monday in a stand in the local wholesale food market.  She also raises small farm animals like barnyard fowl in corrals outside her house.  It’s worth pointing out that Isabel has 15 years’ experience in this activity which has allowed her to retain her business’ regular clientele; she sells her animals to wholesalers in the zone.  In addition, her spouse has a plot of farmland where he’s planted 1.0 hectare of rice which is developing properly; he also helps her with the activities she does there being a good family relationship between the two of them.

Isabel has proposed to expand her inventory with reference to the wholesale fish sales because it’s a very profitable activity in the zone which is why she’s asking for a new loan in the amount of 3500 new soles to buy fresh fish and supplies for her business (buckets, ice, knives and others) which in time will cause her business to grow improving her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is 28 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for two years. Bernadette has requested a loan to buy more vegetable seeds. She joined SPBD in 2012 to make more money. With her earnings, Bernadette will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds for her garden

loans.name: Victor Daniel

texts.es:
Victor vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, así como también tener unas hermosas playas y tambien se desarrollan las actividades de agricultura y la pesca. Victor es un joven muy trabajador, con esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio d eventa de repuestos para vehiculos desde ya hace 3 años, se animo a tener este negocio porque el empezo a estudiar la carrera de Mecanica de mantenimiento, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día según la dificultad de la reparación, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy minucioso y sobre todo responsable y cumplido con su trabajo.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar compra de, bombillas, baterias, claxon, reguladores de voltaje, entre otros,con esta mejora podrá dar una mejor atención a sus clientes ya que tendrá los implementos necesarios; así el seguirá luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de gasfitería y electricidad”.
texts.en:
Victor lives in the city of Ica, which is known for having warm weather throughout the entire year.  It is also the home of Huacachina Lake, a desert oasis that is visited by many tourists.  Whenever he has free time, he enjoys repairing things.  He also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, the flavorful "seco de cabrito" (goat stew).  He only has a high school education, but he would have liked to have studied mechanical engineering.  

With great enthusiasm, Victor leaves for his work as a plumber and electrician.  He works in his business for approximately eight hours each day and is able to serve up to 10 customers in a day based on the difficulty of the repairs.  He believes he has done well in his business because he is very meticulous, responsible, and thorough in his job.  

Victor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the assistance they will provide, he will be able to buy equipment, such as lightbulbs, batteries,wheels, voltage regulators, among others so that he can complete his work.  With this improvement, he will be able to provide better service to his customers since he will have the necessary tools.  He continues to strive each day to accomplish his greatest dream of having a plumbing and electrical company.

loans.use: to purchase lightbulbs, batteries, wheels, voltage regulators, etc.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en: Penina is 29 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling fruits and vegetables in her community, and she has been doing this for two years. Penina has requested a loan to buy more vegetable seeds. She joined SPBD to make more money. With her earnings, Penina will improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds for her garden

loans.name: Potofou

texts.en:
Potofou is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a small business selling barbeque in her community, which she has been doing for two years. 

Potofou is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy ingredients for barbeque. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Potofou will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making barbeque to sell

loans.name: Tala

texts.en:
Tala is a 21-year-old married woman with three children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Tala has requested a loan to pay for farming tools.
 
She became a member of SPBD to gain access to financial services. With her profits, Tala hopes to improve her home and plan for another business.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for growing taro

loans.name: Hjeydi Lucia

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de una comunidad de larreynaga, donde ejerce su actividad económica como es la venta de cosméticos  la que tiene 7 años de ejercer logrando establecer un nivel de sostenibilidad del mismo, su núcleo familiar está compuesto por sus 2 hijos y su esposo este ultimo labora en una empresa de la comunidad y de esa manera apoya económicamente y de esa manera contribuir al desarrollo familiar , la señora Heydi hoy en día tiene una necesidad de continuar mejorando su vivienda y por eso tomo la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento y de esa manera lograr el sueño deseado de tener una condición Digna y mejor nivel de vida para su familia, ya que en esta ocasión la mejora que realizara a su vivienda seria la construcción de un cuarto.
texts.en:
This lady is from the town of Larreynaga where she carries out her economic activity selling cosmetics; she’s been in this line of work for 7 years having attained sustainability in it.  Her nuclear family consists of her two children and her husband who works in a firm in the community and helps her economically thus contributing to family development.  

Heydi needs to do some home improvements so she decided to visit Ceprodel to be benefitted with a loan to attain the dream she so desires of obtaining a proper living condition and better standard of living for her family.  On this occasion the home improvement she’ll do is to build a room.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his taxi's operating permit.

loans.name: Maimoana

texts.en: Maimoana is a 38-year-old woman who is married with 2 children. She runs a business selling household goods, snacks, soft drinks, and frozen goods in her community. She has 10 years of experience with this business. Maimoana has requested a loan to purchase stock for her business. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and renovate her house. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Jose Fidel

texts.es:
José es un hombre que tiene 47  años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con cuatro hijos a su cargo,  vive  en casa propia. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. José  vive en  el caserío Jesús del Valle del distrito de Tambogrande del  departamento de  Piura, así mismo no cuenta con los servicios  básicos;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica José es la crianza/venta de ganado ovino y  aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad José cuenta con 05 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; él  vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.0  has de cultivo de limón lo cual presenta buen estado fenològico y donde viene realizando cosechas semanalmente, de donde le permite tener otro ingresos. 
Actualmente 	José se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.1,200 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceado y fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
José is a 47 year old man with a spouse and four children in his care; he lives in his own house.  It’s mentioned that the quality of life in the community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers in commerce and animal husbandry; some of them also work in agriculture.

José lives in the Jesús del Valle settlement in Tambogrande District of Piura Department.  He does not have basic utilities like all the other families living there under the same conditions.

José’s commercial activity is raising sheep and barnyard fowl to sell.  He raises these animals in corrals outside his house.  It’s worth mentioning that José has 5 years’ experience which has led to his retaining his regular business clientele.  He sells his animals to local wholesalers.  He also has a piece of farmland where he’s growing one hectare of lemons which are developing properly and from which he sells weekly harvests thus earning additional income.

Currently, José has proposed to expand his inventory with respect to the animal sales because it’s a very profitable activity in the zone which is why he’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a new loan in the amount of 1200 new soles to buy animal feed and fertilizer for his lemon crops which in time will lead to improved standard of living for him.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: En el municipio de Telica departamento de León, La señora Angélica se dedica a impartir clases como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 9 años, es casada con 2 hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo, ya que están estudiando en un colegio de la localidad, Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Angélica atraviesa, es de construir un cuarto, de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones, por lo que se decidió  de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Bloques, Perlin, Hierro, Alambre, Zinc, Goloso, Soldaura y Mano de Obra para realizar las mejora en la casa como esta descrito anteriormente, para brindarle  mayor seguridad de su vivienda. Ya que esto le ayudara a darle mayor seguridad a su hija.
texts.en:
Angélica works as an elementary school teacher in a small school in the town of Telica, León Department; she’s been in this occupation for nine years.  She’s married and has two children she needs to provide with basic conditions for their growth and development since they are attending a local school.  

One of the needs Angélica has is to build a room at home because it’s in poor condition which is why she approached Ceprodel to request a loan to buy building materials and supplies like concrete blocks, purlines, rebar, wire, metal sheeting, screws, solder and to pay labor costs to carry out the home improvement mentioned above to provide increased security to her home which will help her provide greater security for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara es una mujer que tiene 55  años de edad, de estado civil casada, con dos  hijos,  vive  en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijos. Se menciona que  La calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia, la mayoría de moradores  son trabajadores independientes  que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales menores y algunos de ellos adicionalmente dedicados a la agricultura. Clara vive en  el caserío Huaca De Barro del distrito de Mòrrope del  departamento de  Lambayeque, así mismo cuenta solamente con el servicio  básico de energía eléctrica,agua;  Así mismo todas las familias que radican ahí viven bajo estas condiciones.
 La actividad comercial a la que se dedica Clara es la crianza/venta de ganado porcino , ovinos  y aves de corral , la crianza de estos animales la realiza en corrales externos a  su domicilio; cabe destacar que en esta actividad Clara cuenta con 9 años de experiencia, lo que le ha permitido mantener su clientela ya establecida en este negocio; ella  vende sus animales a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona; Así mismo su cónyuge también se dedica a su chacra donde tiene instalado  1.5  has de cultivo de leguminosas y maíz o cual presenta buen estado fenològico y donde  le permite tener otro ingresos. 
Actualmente  Clara se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente a su crianza y venta de animales, esto debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona; es por estas circunstancias  que esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de S/.3,000 nuevos soles el cual estará destinado a la inversión de compra de alimentos balanceado y fertilizantes para su cultivo de maíz; lo cual en el tiempo le va permitir ir mejorando su nivel de vida
texts.en:
Clara, 55, is a married woman with two children; she lives in her own house with her spouse and children.  It’s mentioned that the standard of living in the community is at the subsistence level.  Most of the residents are independent workers who work in commerce and in animal husbandry and some of them also work in agriculture.  

Clara lives in the Huaca De Barro settlement in Mórrope District in Lambayeque Department.  She only has electricity and water like all the other families living there under the same conditions.

Clara’s economic activity is raising pigs, sheep and barnyard fowl in corrals outside her house.  It should be noted that Clara has 9 years’ experience which has allowed her to retain her business’ established regular clientele.  She sells her animals to local wholesalers.  In addition, her spouse works in his field where he has 1.5 hectares planted with legumes and corn which are developing properly and which produce additional income.

Currently, Clara has proposed to increase her inventory with respect to the animal sales because it’s a very profitable activity in the zone which is why she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a new loan in the amount of 3000 new soles aimed at purchasing animal feed and fertilizer for the corn crops which in time will lead to an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Suhbat

texts.en: Suhbat is a 56-year-old man who lives with his wife and daughter in the suburban area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife is employed and the daughter studies at the secondary school. He has started a transportation of freight business in which he delivers sacks of coal in wintertime. In summertime, he delivers construction materials. He is experienced in the field and has gained a number of regular customers who have contracts with him. Suhbat is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I would like to expand my business activities by purchasing the supplies in large quantities". The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy more supplies.

loans.use: To buy more supplies

loans.name: Eileen

texts.en:
Eileen is 23 years old, married and has one child. She lives in the city of Poblacion within Sinacaban municipality, which is located in Misamis Occidental Province.

To make a living, Eileen plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. She has been farming for three years and earns 2,000 PHP a month.

This year Eileen joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC that will be used to buy fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use her profits to improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Adela Maritza

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora, vive al lado de su esposo el cual labora como chofer y al lado de sus 2 hijos de 15 y 11 años por los cuales trabaja muy duro y sobre todo daría la vid por verlos felices; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, por sus atractivos turísticos, su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, tuna, entre otros. Cuando Adela tiene un tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión al lado de su familia y también le gusta preparar su platillo favorito el cual son los Pallares con Adobo; ella solo tuvo estudio secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería, por ello trabaja muy duro para darle a sus hijos una buena educación para que sean mejores que ella.

Con mucho entusiasmo Adela trabaja en su cultivo de Tuna y venta de cochinilla, la tuna es una fruta que crece en una planta que se parece a un cactus, asimismo en este tipo de plantas vive un animalito el cual utilizan las empresas de cosméticos, entre otras para dar color a los productos; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajadora y tiene el apoyo de su esposo.

Adela está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá dar mantenimiento al su cultivo como abonos, fertilizantes entre otros y poder comprar mas cochinilla ya que estos animalitos viven en esta especie de fruta, con esta mejora podrá aumentar sus ingresos y tener más producción de cochinilla con lo cual le permitirá seguir creciendo y poder seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un fundo propio”.
texts.en:
Adela’s a very enthusiastic, hardworking woman living with her husband who works as a driver and their two children who are 15 and 11 years old that she works hard for and would give her life for to see them be happy.  

Her house is located in the city of Nazca, a city noted for its hot climate, its tourist attractions, its agriculture, especially cotton, corn and cactus apple, among others.  When Adela has any free time she likes watching television with her family and also to prepare one of her favorite dishes, “Pallares con Adobo.”  She only went to secondary school but would have liked to have studied Nursing.  This is why she works hard to give her children a good education so that they will be better than her.

With much enthusiasm, Adela works growing cactus apples and selling cochineal.  Cactus apples are fruit that grows on a plant that's similar to a cactus.  In addition, a little animal lives on these plants that is used by certain cosmetics firms to, among other things, give color to the products.  She spends about 10 hours daily working in her business and believes that she does well in it because she’s very hardworking and because she has her husband’s support.

Adela is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to provide crop maintenance with manure and fertilizer, among others, and will be able to buy more cochineal since these little animals live off this species of fruit.  With this improvement she will be able to increase her income and have more cochineal production which will allow her to continue to grow and be able to continue striving towards making her greatest dream a reality: to own her own agricultural estate.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and cochineal.

loans.name: Tsendmaa

texts.en:
Tsendmaa is a 50-year-old hardworking and active woman who lives with her retired husband in suburban Ulaanbaatar. Her children are grown and live independently.

In 2005 Tsendmaa went into hairdressing after getting trained. She has gained number of regular customers and is well-known in the area. She said, "In the future I plan to expand my business so I can serve my customers well.”

Tsendmaa’s husband is seriously ill. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan from XacBank to pay her husband’s medical fees.

loans.use: to pay her husband’s medical fees.

loans.name: Cesar Orlando

texts.es: Cesar a sus 29 años es chofer de carga pesada en la ciudad de Playas. Está casado con Johana y tiene 2 hijos en etapa escolar. Su esposa realiza trabajos domésticos  hace 8 años, lo hace para ayudar en la economía de su hogar. Hace 10 años que Cesar empezó con esta actividad en la camioneta de su papa, actualmente es suya porque decidió comprársela ya que es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Labora de lunes a sábado de 7 am hasta las 9 pm. En su trabajo como es de servicios no tiene mayor dificultad. El préstamo lo necesitaría para la compra de llantas a su vehículo. Su meta inmediata es mejorar su vehículo para seguir trabajando y brindarle un mejor futuro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cesar, age 29, is a heavy cargo driver in the city of Playas.  He is married to Johana, and he has two school age children.  His wife has worked as a domestic employee for eight years.  She does that to help with the household’s finances.

Ten years ago Cesar started this business activity with his father’s truck.  It is now his because he decided to buy it as it is his primary means of working.  He works from Mondays through Saturdays from 7:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.  As his work is a service, he does not have any major difficulty.

He needs the loan to buy tires for his vehicle.  His immediate goal is to improve his vehicle in order to continue working and to provide his children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 27 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling ice cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups) in her community and has been doing this for one year. Esther has requested a loan to purchase items for business improvements. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Esther will extend her business and sell it to the public.

loans.use: to purchase items for making ice cakes

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, a 39-year-old married mother of three children, lives in Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, where, for the last 12 years, she manages their coconut farm. This farm gives her an income of 3,000, which enables her to send her children to school.

Analiza has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In the future, she wishes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Teofilo Joffre

texts.es: Teofilo tiene 33 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en el sector conocido como el Fortín. Nelly su esposa es ama de casa. Sus hijos tienen 8, 9 y 11 años de edad y estudian en la escuela fiscal. Su profesión es farmacólogo pero tiene su negocio propio. Desde 1995 comenzó a hacer shampo que vende en su casa, hace un año inicio la tienda y bazar. Su horario de trabajo es desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la tarde contando con la ayuda de su esposa en la atención. En su negocio vende artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, cuadernos, lápices, químicos etc. Teofilo nos cuenta que mayores dificultades no tiene, pero en la época invernal las calles se dañan y complican el transporte. Este es su 5 crédito el cual lo va a invertir en aumentar su negocio comprando arroz, azúcar, aceite, cuadernos etc. En próximos años le gustaría que su negocio crezca más.
texts.en:
Teofilo, age 33, is married and has three children.  He lives in the sector known as El Fortín.  Nelly, his wife, is a housewife.  His children are 8, 9, and 11 years old, and they attend the public school.

He is a pharmacologist by profession, but he has his own business.  In 1995 he started to make shampoo that he sells at his house.  He started the store a year ago.  His work schedule is from six in the morning until eight at night.  His wife helps him with the store.  

In his business he sells basic needs items like rice, sugar, notebooks, pencils, and chemicals, etc.  Teofilo tells us that he does not have any major difficulties.  However, during the winter the streets get damaged, and that complicates transportation.

This is his fifth loan.  He will use it to expand his business by purchasing rice, sugar, oil, and notebooks, etc.  In the coming years he would like his business to grow more.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and notebooks.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old, married and has five children. She lives in Estrella in Sinacaban municipality located in Misamis Occidental Province. For the past seven years Helen has sold seedlings and young plants to local farmers. She earns 1,500 a month in this business.

In 2010, Helen joined GDMPC. She is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan that will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. She plans to use her additional profits to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Oyunmaa

texts.en: Oyunmaa is a 28-year-old woman who lives with her mother and 2 siblings in a suburban area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her mother is unemployed and her siblings study at school. She started a food kiosk business in 2011 in a well-positioned corner. As the business became famous locally, she is planning to increase the types of products. Oyunmaa is a hardworking and active young woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activities by increasing the product types. I have a further plan to open my own store". The total amount she is requesting is 500,000 MNT to buy food supplies.

loans.use: To buy food supplies

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 29 years old and lives in Burgos, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Nancy is engaged in the buying and selling of coconuts. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional working capital.

Nancy has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Nancy hopes to own a house and lot someday.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is from Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old, married, and has three children. Veronica owns and operates a business planting and harvesting sugarcane "tubo" to sell. She has been in her business for 12 years and earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Veronica joined GDMPC. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en: Arcelita is married with three children. She is 35 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Arcelita manages their garden business, where she plants root crops to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and earns 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. She requested a loan of 5,000 (PHP) to purchase farm chemicals. Arcelita has been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC for just this year. In the future, Arcelita's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a new house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Juvitha

texts.en:
Juvitha is 39 years old and widowed with four children. She lives in Caputol in Aloran municipality, Misamis Occidental Province. She is a farmer who has grown rice for the past fifteen years.

Juvitha has been a member of PMPC for six years. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides, as well as to redeem some coconut plantation land she had to pawn.

Juvitha’s ambition is to have a good future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, as well as to redeem some coconut plantation land.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is is 37 years old and married with three children. She lives in Tuyabang Bajo, a part of Oroquieta City. For the past six years she has had a business fattening hogs, earning approximately 2,000 PHP a month.
